intro: Mesembryanthemum carneum, commonly known as the fat-leaf mesembryanthemum, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers during the cooler months, typically in spring or early summer. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to semi-desert conditions. Mesembryanthemum carneum is popular among succulent enthusiasts due to its ornamental appearance and ease of care.
